title: Capacitor - spacing 1 mm and dielectric constant 5

content.question: A charged, isolated, parallel-plate capacitor has its plates spaced a distance of <math alttext="3 millimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>mm</mi></math> apart, and the space between the plates is filled with air. In this configuration, the electric field between the plates has a magnitude <math alttext="E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Then the plates are adjusted to have a spacing of <math alttext="1 millimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>mm</mi></math> and a material with a dielectric constant of <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> is inserted to completely fill the space between the plates. In the second configuration the plates have an electric field of magnitude <math alttext="E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> between them. What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction E sub 2 over E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
